isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the 4th-5th speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft front ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Remove 4th-5th Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft Front

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the groove at the mainshaft rear ( Figure 113).

figure.caption: Figure 113. Remove Snap Ring From Groove at Mainshaft Rear

step1.para: Remove the reverse gear and spacer from the mainshaft rear ( Figure 114).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Remove Reverse Gear and Spacer From Mainshaft Rear

step1.para: Remove the key from the mainshaft key way ( Figure 115).

figure.caption: Figure 115. Remove Key From Mainshaft Key Way

note.para: When removing limit washers, spacers and gears, note their location on the mainshaft to make reassembly easier. Keep the internal-splined washers and external-splined spacers with the gear from which they were removed. There is ONLY one limit washer and one spacer belonging to each gear.

step1.para: Turn the reverse gear limit washer to align its splines with those of the mainshaft and remove washer ( Figure 116).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Align Reverse Gear Limit Washer Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Remove the 1st-Reverse speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft ( Figure 117).

figure.caption: Figure 117. Remove 1st-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver to turn the limit washer in the hub of 1st speed gear to align its splines with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 118).

figure.caption: Figure 118. Align Limit Washer Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Remove the 1st speed gear from the mainshaft ( Figure 119). Remove the limit washer, spacer, and gear. If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear.

figure.caption: Figure 119. Remove 1st Speed Gear From Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove each remaining gear, limit washer, spacer, and sliding clutch from the mainshaft ( Figure 120). If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of each gear.

figure.caption: Figure 120. Remove Gear, Limit Washer, Spacer and Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft
